Critical Reflective Journal

Fūdogotchi wk 7 - Burnout isn't paradise

Jul 30, 2017

BLE proves a step too far as the scope of the project is re-assessed.

Having worked so hard during the planning and presentation stages of this project, I feel disappointed with my progress over the past two weeks. I have struggled to maintain the momentum and can only put it down to exhaustion.

This would suggest that our planning stage was overly ambitious and not sustainable. It’s easy to get carried away with an idea, especially considering the scope of many modern apps. Lesson learned; we have re-adressed our plans, with good feedback from Carl who has recommended we drop the Bluetooth stretch goal due to time constraints.

Burnout is what happens when you try to avoid being human for too long. — Michael Gungor

About

Hi I'm Phil Penny, based in the UK. I have a solid background in design and I have chosen to study this MA to improve my programming skills - I am currently in the situation whereby I can design anything that comes into my head but I cannot build it into a working application. By the end of this course I hope to have reached a point where I am self-sufficient, so I am able to put any ideas I have into practice from start to finish. This course is also a step on my journey into a potential future career as a lecturer or tutor.

You can view some of my previous work at philpenny.co.uk or check out my personal blog at naturalmohican.com
